entry.title: Combined summary - Teleport Transactions: A CoinSwap implementation for Bitcoin
entry.summary: I apologize, I seem to have made a mistake in my previous response. Based on the context provided, the summary is as follows:CoinSwap is a new privacy improvement for Bitcoin transactions that allows users to create a special kind of transaction which appears normal but ends up in an entirely unconnected address, providing greater privacy. CoinSwap can be implemented as a standalone app or library for existing wallets. The project can create multi-transaction and multi-hop CoinSwaps to prevent amount correlation and provide more privacy. The user, called the taker, organizes the process and decides the CoinSwap amount, makers, and transactions. Makers follow the protocol and collect their fees without knowing their position in the route. A passive observer cannot distinguish between single-hop and multi-hop CoinSwaps, making it a more private alternative to CoinJoin. However, the project is still under development, and attacks are possible, so it should not be used with real money yet. The CoinSwap addresses appear as 2-of-2 multisignature addresses, but the plan is to use ECDSA-2P to make them look like regular single-signature addresses before improving privacy and fungibility massively. CoinSwap improves privacy and increases fungibility while using less block space and being cheaper in miner fees, making it the next generation of Bitcoin on-chain privacy tech.
